{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presented with pain in calf muscles on exercise and excessive glycogen in the muscle biopsy. This suggests a glycogen storage disorder. Among the given options, the most likely enzyme deficiency is phosphorylase enzyme, as it is responsible for the breakdown of glycogen into glucose-1-phosphate. Deficiency of phosphorylase enzyme leads to the accumulation of glycogen in the muscle.", "answer_choice": "D. Phosphorylase enzyme"}
